title: Semaphore
guide:
# The Semaphore Alphabet: Talking with Flags

## 1. The Concept (ELI7)
Imagine you are standing on a ship. It's too loud to shout.
You have two flags (usually red and yellow).
You become a **Human Clock**.

* Your **Head** is **12:00**.
* Your **Feet** are **6:00**.
* Your **Left Hand** is **9:00**.
* Your **Right Hand** is **3:00**.

To say a letter, you just point the flags to specific hours on the clock.
*Note: Always read these positions as if you are looking AT the person.*

---

## 2. The Complete Alphabet (Clock Positions)
**Rest Position:** Both flags at 6 (Down).

### First Circle (One Flag is always Down/6)
*These use only one arm. The other stays down.*

| Letter | Position | Clock Numbers |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **A** | Low Left | **7** |
| **B** | Horizontal Left | **9** |
| **C** | High Left | **10** |
| **D** | Straight Up | **12** |
| **E** | High Right | **2** |
| **F** | Horizontal Right | **3** |
| **G** | Low Right | **5** |

### Second Circle (One Flag is always at 7 / Low Left)
*Hold one flag at "A" (7), move the other.*

| Letter | Positions | Clock Numbers |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **H** | A + B | **7 & 9** |
| **I** | A + C | **7 & 10** |
| **K** | A + D | **7 & 12** |
| **L** | A + E | **7 & 2** |
| **M** | A + F | **7 & 3** |
| **N** | A + G | **7 & 5** |

*(Note: J is special, it skips this circle!)*

### Third Circle (One Flag is always at 9 / Flat Left)
*Hold one flag at "B" (9), move the other.*

| Letter | Positions | Clock Numbers |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **O** | B + C | **9 & 10** |
| **P** | B + D | **9 & 12** |
| **Q** | B + E | **9 & 2** |
| **R** | B + F | **9 & 3** |
| **S** | B + G | **9 & 5** |

### Fourth Circle (One Flag is always at 10 / High Left)
*Hold one flag at "C" (10), move the other.*

| Letter | Positions | Clock Numbers |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **T** | C + D | **10 & 12** |
| **U** | C + E | **10 & 2** |
| **Y** | C + F | **10 & 3** |

*(Note: Y jumps in here because it's rarely used)*

### The Weirdos (Special Shapes)
These don't fit the perfect circles or are "leftovers".

| Letter | Positions | Clock Numbers | Shape Trick |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **J** | D + F | **12 & 3** | Up & Right (Like a hook) |
| **V** | D + G | **12 & 5** | Up & Low Right (Like a checkmark) |
| **W** | E + F | **2 & 3** | High Right & Flat Right |
| **X** | E + G | **2 & 5** | High Right & Low Right |
| **Z** | F + G | **3 & 5** | Flat Right & Low Right |

---

## 3. Numbers (0-9)
To signal a number, first make the **Numeral Sign** (Flags at **2 & 10**, crossed like an X).
Then, use the letters A-K.

| Number | Letter Code |
| :--- | :--- |
| **1** | **A** |
| **2** | **B** |
| **3** | **C** |
| **4** | **D** |
| **5** | **E** |
| **6** | **F** |
| **7** | **G** |
| **8** | **H** |
| **9** | **I** |
| **0** | **K** |

---

## 4. Native Mnemonics (English)

* **"A to G is all me":** The first 7 letters (A-G) are just one arm moving around the clock like a single hand.
* **"R is Flat":** The letter R uses 9 and 3. Both arms are flat out. It looks like the horizon.
* **"D is for Disc":** D is straight up (12), like you are holding the sun (Disc).
